intro: Lutzia litorea, commonly known as the coastal lantana, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other moist, sandy soils. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in saline environments. Lutzia litorea plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
